data.title: Chilli,Hot Dogs,Tamales! oh My!
data.text:
My favorite Chilli place in town! More flavor than the other place.
Good options. Tamales  and hot dogs.great combos.

owner_response.author: moriii2, Owner at Dew Chilli Parlor, responded to this review
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wow!
data.text: We where told about this by a friend and it did not disappoint. My wife and I had the torpedo, two tamales with chills,sour cream ,cheese and fritos. This is not the place you want to go if you are on a diet but the food sure was very good. The place is very small and quaint. If you want a treat with not worrying about the calories this is your place.

owner_response.author: moriii2, Owner at Dew Chilli Parlor, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you Chris for the review, myself and the entire Dew Crew really appreciates your kind comments. If you or anyone comes in on a diet we promise we won't tell a soul on what was ordered :). Thank you again and hope to see you at the Dew again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Real Old-School Chili
data.text:
I was happy to see that the Dew is back in business!  On a trip through Springfield earlier this week, I tried a bowl of chili with just oyster crackers (no cheese, onion or other toppings).  The chili is Old-School Midwestern style.  It has a meaty flavor and a slight afterburn, but not too spicy.

The staff was very pleasant to deal with and they were efficient in preparing my order to go.

On my next trip through Springfield, I will definitely return to the Dew!

owner_response.author: moriii2, Owner at Dew Chilli Parlor, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you Harold for stopping by the Dew Chilli Parlor while passing through Springfield and taking the time to write this review. We look forward to serving you again soon on your next trip through Springfield!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Glad I finally got my husband here!
data.text: I love the chilli here and finally go to take my husband. He liked it very much too.The menu is all about it, so don't go expecting to find burgers and fries. The have lots of variations centered around chilli, hot dogs, and tamales. The chilli is meaty and not greasy. The atmosphere and service are top notch too. Can't wait to go back.

owner_response.author: moriii2, Owner at Dew Chilli Parlor, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for the nice review and I'm glad you had a great experience for your first time at the parlor. Your positive feedback means a lot to our little historical parlor off Route 66.  We look forward to serving you again soon at the Dew. ~ The Dew Chilli Parlor Crew.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not Bad
data.text: If you are into Chili and Hot dogs this is a place for you. They serve beef in their chili and serve all beef hot dogs. The place is small, Service is good. Its a simple place to kind of get away from the tourist scene. They also kind of close early I believe around 7PM.

data.title: Barrett Chilli
data.text: My father's family lived across the street on 5th when he grew up.  His father also ran the coffee shop at St. John's in the 1950's. He says the chilli is the closest to the Barrett family coffee shop one. Let me tell you, that's a complement! His brother's from out of town also agree.

data.title: There's only beef...
data.text: The chili is good, according to my husband. But there are no non-beef chili options at this main location. They used to have a store in the local mall food court (since closed) but they offered a "veggie" chili. I asked for this one day at lunch at this location & the staff person acted like he had no idea what I was talking about. I explained & his response was, We don't offer that here b/c we don't have a full kitchen. Huh? Their only non-beef option of any kind at that time (which was about 3 mos ago) was a chicken salad sandwich. I declined & we walked out. My suggestion is to start offering a non-beef option for the chili & at least a grilled cheese. The other big chili competitor in Springfield does! And, I agree with other reviewers that it is a bit expensive for the portion sizes & parking is an issue.

data.title: good chili and hot dog
data.text: This is a good place to eat but it is a bit expensive for a small bowl of chili with a hot dog.  The employees are very friendly and it has a home town feeling to it.  Never a stranger when you eat her.

data.title: CLASSIC!
data.text: Technically this is a Springfield staple for 100 years.  Was gone from the scene for awhile but brought back.  When things are "brought back" they sometimes lack that nostalgia that made it great.  Not this place.  Like the "retro" Mustangs that Ford did right, this too has been done right!  Although the chili could have been a little warmer (temperature wise, because mine was a little luke warm), this is the same food I remember as a kid.  They kept the recipe and the menu the same.  Get the tamale in the bottom of a chili bowl, you will not regret it.  NOWHERE in Springfield makes a better milkshake!!!  So glad to have them back. My other complaint was the video gaming AND when I was there a guy was sitting at the slot machine with a toddler on his lap.  I don't think it's illegal but it sure bothered me.  I wish the Dew and other restaurants around Springfield would see that the slots add NOTHING to their atmosphere or marketability.

data.title: Warm and friendly -- and so was the chilli!
data.text: Visited on a dreary and cold Sunday.  Parking was a problem: I think we ended up parked illegally in the McDonalds lot next door, but nobody must have noticed since we didn't get harassed or towed.  We were able to be served right away, as it wasn't too busy.  We asked for the "quintessential chilli experience" and ordered a bowl of chilli (note the double "L") and a tamale, and it was fantastic.  A good amount of spiciness could be amplified by their available sauces and spices, but the chilli itself is fantastic: a perfect blend of saucy and beany and meaty, it's exactly what I think of when I think of "chili".  The owner/operator was very friendly and we had a nice talk with him about the history of the parlor and its future.  The decor is tidy and retro.  We also had a milkshake and it, too, was excellent.  I really enjoyed our visit and we will definitely stop back in next time we're in Springfield.

data.title: Greatest Chilli in the world
data.text: My family picked up a few quarts the day before Thanksgiving. Our flight was delayed and we arrived very late, but the Dew was so good. This is a unique type of chilli that you must try.

data.title: At last in he mall.
data.text: I am a chilli guy , one l or 2? Beans or no beans? it does not matter to me. I like flavor. 32 years ago, when I moved to Springfield, the Dew Parlor was my favorite chilli. When they closed I was sad. When they opened again last year I was happy but their parking was a problem . Now they have a location in the food court of the White Oaks Mall. I can get it again. Try it and tell me if you think that it is the best you have ever had. We used to have "Joe's Chilli Bowl" a place that would give them a run for their money but that one is closed now.

data.title: OK
data.text: Return to the original… and so? Chili-dog and tea, $8+, not that good. More chili in the bowl and more greeting from the help.

data.title: Okay Chili
data.text: Usually we hit Joe Roger's Chili when in Springfield but they were closed at the time of our visit. Everything we read said we needed to try Dew Chili. Well we did and it was okay. It only comes in one heat level. I would have liked a little more kick in mine. Although the food was okay and the atmosphere good, it wasn't what I was expecting. I was expecting a little dive, hole in the wall restaurant (like Joe's) for my greasy bowl of goodness.

data.title: Dew Chilli Parlor returns
data.text: Excellent chilli set in a fifties location on south fifth street just north of South Grand. A truly outstanding place you got to see.

data.title: Home of Good Chili
data.text: Their chili is by far the best I've had.  Iusually get the double-header which has a tamale in it.  Just plain old good chili!!!!!

data.title: Best chilli in town! A MUST stop for tourists and locals alike
data.text: Dew Chilli has a rich history in Springfield (http://www.dewchilliparlor.com/OurStory.aspx). The flavor is mild "(NOT bland) but if you prefer to spice things up there are plenty of add-ins available. Heat is not important to me, it's the flavor and quality ingredients that count. Nice selection of hot dogs to accompany a bowl of chilli. On a separate visit I ordered The Torpedo and a vanilla milkshake and it really hit the spot. The Torpedo was a perfect choice for those who can't decide between a chilli with tamale and a hot dog. When you step inside, don't forget to look down! The unique penny floor is really one-of-a-kind; my 2 year old daughter kept trying to pick the pennies up and was squealing with delight!

data.title: Very good Chilli
data.text: Great historic Chilli Parlor with old time recipe that is great. Had Chilli first time and Chilli dog and Chilli second time and loved both.

data.title: DISSAPOINTED
data.text: Waited months for the Dew to reopen use to go here years ago and the chilli was excellent. I ordered a large chilli, tamale and tea. Chilli wa served in styrofoam cups ,the chilli was bland so was the tamale.

data.title: Do the "Dew" Chilli Parlor
data.text:
I checked out the recently reopened Dew Chilli Parlor on 5th Street.  I went around 11:30 on a Friday and the place was pretty packed.  It has about 10+ tables inside and a few benches outside. I ordered a small chilli (light on the oil), tamale, and a glass of water.  I'm very picky when it comes to chilli & was impressed with how tasty it was.  The service was quick, atmosphere was nice, and my lunch was around $7.00 .

It's located on a one-way street with limited parking so I parked next door at the McDonalds parking lot.
